content: gauge 5 3 st/inch on size 6 needles cast on 72 stitches brim 12 row k2 p2 rib on size 4 circs body switch to size 6 and mark repeat sections pattern repeat 12 stitches times 6 per row row 1 k6 p6 row 2 p1 k5 p5 k1 row 3 p2 k4 p4 k2 row 4 p3 k3 p3 k3 row5 p4 k2 p2 k4 row 6 p5 k1 p1 k5 row7 p6 k6 row8 k6 p6 row 9 k5 p1 k1 p5 row 10 k4 p2 k2 p4 row 11 k3 p3 k3 p3 row 12 k2 p4 k4 p2 row 13 k1 p5 k5 p1 row 14 k6 p6 row 15-16 k crown move markers as you work the first round note that now on odd row you can knit to 2 stitches before marker and k2tog repeat to end the result will be the same as following the pattern below yes easy-peasy round 1 *k7 k2tog repeat from * to end 64 stitches round 2 and all even rounds knit round 3 *k6 k2tog repeat from * to end 56 stitches round 5 *k5 k2tog repeat from * to end 48 stitches round 7 *k4 k2tog repeat from * to end 40 stitches round 9 *k3 k2tog repeat from * to end 32 stitches round 11 *k2 k2tog repeat from * to end 24 stitches round 13 *k1 k2tog repeat from * to end 16 stitches round 15 *k2tog repeat from * to end 8 stitches cut yarn leaving a 6-inch tail and thread through remaining 8 stitches to secure
